meanings.definition: A reproduction of a previously published work.
meanings.sent1: I bought a reprint of my favorite book to give as a gift.
meanings.sent2: The library had a collection of reprints of classic novels.
meanings.sent3: The reprint of the old painting looked just like the original.
meanings.sent4: Her memory was like a reprint of a beautiful dream, clear and vivid.
meanings.sent5: The reprint of the photograph brought back nostalgic memories.

meanings.sent1: The publisher decided to reprint the best-selling book due to high demand.
meanings.sent2: They will reprint the brochure with updated information for the event.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally hit the reprint button twice, and now I have two copies.
meanings.sent4: The artist wanted to reprint the limited edition artwork for a special exhibition.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked the student to reprint the essay with corrections.
